author: Special Correspondent
text:
‘Space Kidz India’, a Chennai-based organisation designing innovative concepts for school students, has joined hands with Dr APJ Abdul Kalam International Foundation to organise national-level ‘Young Scientist India - 2016’ and ‘Make for India - 2016’ contests for school and college students respectively.

‘Space Kidz India’ Director Srimathy Kesan visited ‘House of Kalam’ here on Sunday and announced the contests with A.P.J.M. Maraikayar, elder brother of Kalam, Naseema Maraikayar and A.P.J.M.J. Sheik Saleem, managing trustees of the Foundation.

School students from classes IX to XII could come out with their projects on topics such as space and aeronautics, electronics and electrical, robotics, agriculture and environment. College students could come out with projects which were economically viable and technologically useful for the people, Ms. Kesan said.

The registration for the contest would begin on March 7 and the students should submit the projects online by May 30, she said.

The finalists would be shortlisted by July 18, she said.

The winners would be awarded prizes here on July 27, the first death anniversary of Kalam, and the best projects would be exhibited in Chennai.The winners would also be taken to Russian Space Centre for a three-day workshop, she added.
title: National-level science contest
